author: electricmastro

text:
@gunslingerfry That would have been Final Fantasy VI, when it seemed like Kefka had won, with no possibility at all of anything else good. I don't think that moment was as powerful as what's in this game though (I was much younger when I played FFVI than M3, and thus it was easier to impress me).

Yeah, I know, not really the game you'd expect, but it's the truth.
author: masterplusmargarita

text: What I really love about Mother 3 is how emotionally impacting it is. I'm not even gonna get started on the main story / villains, but it really made you love all the characters. Everyone in Tazmilly Village was someone you knew, both in their defects and positive sides. You got to actually consider them as a person, instead of a bunch of pixels. Only 2 games have suceeded at making me cry, and Mother 3 is one of those games.
author: masterplusmargarita

text: Mother 3 was an absolute masterpiece.  I always think of it as the Grand Slam after 2 strikes compared to the other Mother games =P
author: ProjectJ

text: @pirateludwig Well, being fair, they merged several similar tracks into one for the brawl version. I think they decided to title it after the one that made the recurring melody. And that decision was made by the developers, the developers that likely also worked on that very game... What I mean to say is: you're taking things a bit too seriously here...

author: David E.

text: This theme is what I always associate Mother with.
author: Sean Saunders

text: They can't "Get Around" it - they'd still have to make the payoffs... which could come to a really high price total.  Keep in mind, Mother isn't quite as big as it might sound, it just has an exceedingly loud (and oftentimes obnoxious) fanbase.  The question comes down to if it would be worth the time and money... and the fact there isn't a solid "yes" answer to that is probably what makes them hesitant.
author: Garlyle Wilds

text:
Well, it did bring over Earthbound (Mother 2) originally - in modern times, however, copyright and trademark laws have gotten even more ridiculous and trying to release Earthbound again would be a potential can of worms.

As for Mother 3, it's a GBA game - at this point, as the DSi doesn't support GBA game cartridges, it's basically too late and obsolete.
author: Garlyle Wilds

text: Yay for Mother 3!!!!!!
